body_html:
1. N stands for batch size. So input is the network outputs of N input data. C is the number of classes. Each value in target means the correct class of the corresponding input data. Note that target is not one-hot encoded but just simply the class indices.
  2. Your target should be only size (1,) for reasons above.

Finally, since Github is used for tracing bugs / feature requests, this type of post is better placed at discuss.pytorch.org. :)
body_text:
N stands for batch size. So input is the network outputs of N input data. C is the number of classes. Each value in target means the correct class of the corresponding input data. Note that target is not one-hot encoded but just simply the class indices.
Your target should be only size (1,) for reasons above.

Finally, since Github is used for tracing bugs / feature requests, this type of post is better placed at discuss.pytorch.org. :)
body:
1. `N` stands for batch size. So `input` is the network outputs of `N` input data. `C` is the number of classes. Each value in `target` means the correct class of the corresponding input data. Note that `target` is not one-hot encoded but just simply the class indices.
2. Your target should be only size `(1,)` for reasons above.

Finally, since Github is used for tracing bugs / feature requests, this type of post is better placed at discuss.pytorch.org. :)
